text:
<no title>

<setup: two men in a stuffy room, tense mood>  
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>  
Porfiry: "He'll lie well, clever as he is."  

Raskolnikov: "I see clearly now... you suspect me."  

Porfiry: "Why so pale, Rodion? Stuffy room?"  

---  

<setup: Raskolnikov standing, trembling, anxious>  
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>  
Raskolnikov: "I can’t stand this... the pressure!"  

Porfiry: "Your temperament gives you away!"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The passage explores how a person's temperament can betray them, even when they attempt to deceive others with cleverness and wit.
